sense.def: STANDARD NAME: Duke Zhuāng of Lǔ (reigned 693 - 662)ALTERNATIVE NAMES: Tóng 同.PARENTS: Son of >Lǔ Huán gōng 魯桓公.WIVES: Married to Mèng Rèn 孟任, and Āi Jiāng 哀姜 of Qi2 齊 who was notorious for entertaining an incestuous relationship with her brother.CHILDREN: Father of >Lǔ Mǐn gōng 魯閔湣公 and >Lǔ Xī gōng 魯僖公.

tls:text.tls:line: "What might it be you require from me?"

tls:text.tls:line: "What might it be you require from me?"
"What might it be you require from me?"

"Admittedly Qi is strong, and Lu is weak," replied Cao Mo,

tls:text.tls:line: "But your great nation has gone too far in its violation of our country.

Let one of her acolytes go and get her to hurry up!"
and facing the Yellow River he stood in polite ritual revence fo a good while.

tls:text.tls:line: The Seniors, the state officials, and the bystanders were all terrified:
Ximen Bao looked around and said:
It would appear that the Lord of the Yellow River will detain his guests for a long time.
It would appear that the Lord of the Yellow River will detain his guests for a long time.

sense.def: cause N to remain in place

sense.def: bow one's head to the ground

sense.def: in a moment, momentarily (this is a rare instance of an adverb being postposed to the verb it modifies)

they never again presumed to propose to find wives for the Lord of the Yellow River.

sense.def: from birth; at birth 生而

as an infant, he was able to speak,
as an infant, he was able to speak,

as a boy, he was quick,
as a boy, he was quick,

as a youth, he was industrious,
as a youth, he was industrious,

The feudal lords invaded one another
The feudal lords invaded one another
and tyrannized the families of the hundred cognomens.

sense.def: be violent so as to tyrannise

in order to march upon those who did not pay tribute [to Shen-nung].

tls:text.tls:line: The feudal lords all came to subordinate themselves [to him],
The feudal lords all came to subordinate themselves [to him],

sense.def: to come in order to V; come so as to V; come for the purpose of Ving

tls:text.tls:line: The feudal lords all came to subordinate themselves [to him],

tls:text.tls:line: The feudal lords all came to subordinate themselves [to him],

tls:text.tls:line: The feudal lords all came to subordinate themselves [to him],

no one was able chastise [him].

sense.def: launch a punitive attack against the contextually determinate N

tls:text.tls:line: Yen-ti (The Flaming Emperor) had a desire to oppress the feudal lords,
and the feudal lords all turned to Hsüan-yüan
and the feudal lords all turned to Hsüan-yüan

sense.def: rally to (a king or leader), converge on; rally to (a place); turn to, orientate oneself towards (an aim)

tls:text.tls:line: Hsüan-yüan then practiced deeds of merit and expanded his military power.
Hsüan-yüan then practiced deeds of merit and expanded his military power.

sense.def: cultivate (one's person, the ancients etc); apply oneself to; train and exercise (troops); occasionally also with negative objects: LH 2 修詐 "cultivate fraudulence"

tls:text.tls:line: Hsüan-yüan then practiced deeds of merit and expanded his military power.

sense.def: somebody's inner power; somebody's charismatic virtue

tls:text.tls:line: Hsüan-yüan then practiced deeds of merit and expanded his military power.
He ordered the five energies,
He ordered the five energies,
He ordered the five energies,

sense.def: traditionally understood as: 仁，義，禮，智，信

tls:text.tls:line: He ordered the five energies,

sense.def: = Five Agents 五行：metal, wood, water, fire earth

tls:text.tls:line: planted the five grains,
planted the five grains,

sense.def: =五穀 the five kinds of grain： 稻，黍，麥，菽，稷

tls:text.tls:line: soothed the common people

sense.def: to pacify, bring peace to, look well after the concerns of; euphemistic for "subjugate"

tls:text.tls:line: and serveyed the four quarters;
and serveyed the four quarters;

sense.def: all the Four Regions, the whole world; all sorts of places

tls:text.tls:line: he trained [the armies of] the Hsiung and the P'i, the P'i and the Hsiu, and the Ch'u and the Hu

sense.def: read jiào train up; give military instruction to

tls:text.tls:line: was he able to put his ideas into practice.

form.pron: dé dé de děi qí zhì

sense.def: achieve one's purpose; reach one's aims;

tls:text.tls:line: and did not implement the emperor's orders.
and did not implement the emperor's orders.
and did not implement the emperor's orders.
Thereupon, The Huan-ti called in troops from the feudal lords

sense.def: At that point, Whereupon; at that time; at this time

tls:text.tls:line: Thereupon, The Huan-ti called in troops from the feudal lords
Thereupon, The Huan-ti called in troops from the feudal lords

sense.def: the members of the army, the soldiers of an army (traditionally 2500 men)

tls:text.tls:line: and fought with Ch'ih-yu in the wilderness of [Mount] Cho-lu (Deer Chase).
Subsequently he captured and killed Ch'ih-yu.

sense.def: in the event 上遂不納 "the Emperor in the end did not accept it".

tls:text.tls:line: Subsequently he captured and killed Ch'ih-yu.

sense.def: =擒 capture (an animal in chase); take prisoner (a person in war)

seg.line: 而諸侯咸尊軒轅為天子，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 而諸侯咸尊軒轅為天子，
tls:text.tls:line: The feudal lords all honored Hsüan as the Son of Heaven.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 而諸侯咸尊軒轅為天子，
tls:text.tls:line: The feudal lords all honored Hsüan as the Son of Heaven.

sense.def: honour N1 so as to make him N2

tls:text.tls:line: If there was any place in the world where people would not submit,

sense.def: obey the wishes and orders of the contextually determinate N

tls:text.tls:line: The Huang-ti would go and march upon it.

sense.def: as a reaction to this, consequently, on the grounds of this; accordingly

tls:text.tls:line: The Huang-ti would go and march upon it.

sense.def: launch a punitive military campaign against; chastise, go on a punitive expedition against

tls:text.tls:line: Once it had been pacified, he would leave.
Once it had been pacified, he would leave.

sense.def: when, as soon as, once the subject had V-ed, then

tls:text.tls:line: He opened roads through the mountains
He opened roads through the mountains

sense.def: cause N to cut through so as to reach the aim

tls:text.tls:line: and never had a chance to repose.
and never had a chance to repose.

sense.def: take time off to recuperate, rest

tls:text.tls:line: To the east he traveled as far as to the sea,

sense.def: go as far as; reach as far as (a place)

tls:text.tls:line: climbed Mount Chi-Huan

sense.def: climb up, go up; also by flying: 豋天 "rise to Heaven".

tls:text.tls:line: and Mount Tai.

sense.def: get as far as, reach as far as; get to the place N

tls:text.tls:line: and climbed Mount Chi t'ou

sense.def: climb up, go up; also by flying: 豋天 "rise to Heaven".

tls:text.tls:line: To the north he chased away the Hsün-yu,

sense.def: defeat so as to cause to flee> drive into flight; German: in die Flucht schlagen

tls:text.tls:line: and made his capital on the slopes of [Mount] Cho-lu.
and made his capital on the slopes of [Mount] Cho-lu.
He moved around and had no constant residence.
He moved around and had no constant residence.
He moved around and had no constant residence.
He used encamped armies as a surrounding garrison.
He used encamped armies as a surrounding garrison.
Official titles all used the term "cloud" as a [part of] their designation

sense.def: give a name to the contextually determinate N

tls:text.tls:line: He set up the Left and Right Grand Superintendents
to superintend the myriad states.
to superintend the myriad states.

seg.line: 而鬼神山川封禪與為多焉。

tls:text.tls:srcline: 而鬼神山川封禪與為多焉。
tls:text.tls:line: and their sacrifices to spirits, to mountains and rivers, as well as the Feng and Shan sacrifices during thi time are considered to be the most frequent [in history].

sense.def: be more than anywhere else; be the most

tls:text.tls:line: He aquired a precious tripod

sense.def: obtain through effort, get hold of

tls:text.tls:line: He aquired a precious tripod
He aquired a precious tripod
and, by manipulating the counting sticks, made a calendar.
and, by manipulating the counting sticks, made a calendar.
He hand picked Feng-hou, Li'mu, Ch'iang-hsien, and Ta-hung

sense.def: choose (a person) for promotion, recommend; appoint to a high position

tls:text.tls:line: and conserved water, fire, materials and goods.
and for that reason was called The Huang-ti.

sense.def: be referred to by the designation X

tls:text.tls:line: He gained an auspicious omen related to earth's power
He gained an auspicious omen related to earth's power

sense.def: trait; characteristic feature; characteristic powers (of wine etc)

tls:line.title: 史記 (en) Translation of 史記 into (en)

tls:text.tls:line: He toiled with his mental and physical energies, with his ears and his eyes,He toiled with his mental and physical energies, with his ears and his eyes, Il n’épargna aucune peine à son cœur, à sa force, à ses oreilles et à ses yeux.

sense.def: exert to the utmost; tire out

tls:text.tls:line: The Huang-ti lived at the hill of Hsüan-yüan.

sense.def: 彭蠡之川 "the river Pengli" the N2 constituted by/that is none other than N1

tls:text.tls:line: And took the daughter of the Hsi-ling [Clan] to be his wife.

sense.def: get married to; take as a wife (a daughter/relative of)

tls:text.tls:line: Lei-tsu was the primary mate of The Huang-ti.
Their descendants all possessed the world.

sense.def: HF 9.2.34: be formally or effectively in charge of (a state); control (a person) 有國

tls:text.tls:line: Their descendants all possessed the world.

sense.def: come to control, come to ruler over, come to be in charge of 有國"take over govt"

tls:text.tls:line: Ch'ing-yang was ordered to live down be The Chiang River.
Ch'ing-yang was ordered to live down be The Chiang River.

sense.def: settle in, go to reside in, take up residence in

tls:text.tls:line: He was sent down to live by the Jo River.
He was sent down to live by the Jo River.

sense.def: settle in, go to reside in, take up residence in

tls:text.tls:line: Kao-yang had a sagacious character.

sense.def: (made great by the presence of ancient sages>) great, hallowed

tls:text.tls:line: Kao-yang had a sagacious character.
When The Huang-ti passed away,
he was buried at Mount Ch'iao.
This was the Emperor Chuan-hsü.
Serene and profound, he had [far-reaching] plans.

sense.def: be serene, have peace of mind, be calm 甚靜
